abilities.name: Primal Veil
abilities.text: As long as Armaldo is your Active Pokémon, each player can't play any Supporter Cards.

abilities.name: Super Suction Cups
abilities.text: As long as Cradily is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Pokémon can't retreat.

attacks.name: Lure Poison
attacks.text: Before using this effect, you may switch the Defending Pokémon with 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon, if any. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counters from Cradily (remove 1 if there is only 1).

abilities.name: Poison Payback
abilities.text: If Cacturne is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Cacturne is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Judgement
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, the Defending Pokémon is Knocked Out.

attacks.name: Random Curse
attacks.text: Put a total of 5 damage counters on all Defending Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Flareon.

attacks.name: Double Kick
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Lightning Strike
attacks.text: You may discard all Lightning Energy cards attached to Jolteon. If you do, this attack's base damage is 70 instead of 40.

abilities.name: Rain Dish
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Ludicolo.

attacks.name: Hydro Punch
attacks.text: Does 50 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Ludicolo but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Lunar Eclipse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Solrock is in play, you may use this power. Until the end of your turn, Lunatone's type is Darkness. This power can't be used if Lunatone is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cosmic Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Scam
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You may have your opponent shuffle a Supporter card you find there into his or her deck. If you do, your opponent draws a card.

attacks.name: Metal Hook
attacks.text: Before doing damage, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 20 damage to the new Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Supernatural
attacks.text: Look at your opponent's hand. You may use the effect of a Supporter card you find there as the effect of this attack. (The Supporter card remains in your opponent's hand.)

attacks.name: Dark Bind
attacks.text: You may discard a Darkness Energy card attached to Sableye. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Deadly Poison
attacks.text: You may discard a Grass Energy card attached to Seviper. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Extra Poison
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Pokémon-ex, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.

abilities.name: Fan Away
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, return 1 Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon to your opponent's hand. This power can't be used if Shiftry is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Light Touch Throw
attacks.text: Does 80 damage minus 10 damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

abilities.name: Fire Veil
abilities.text: If Arcanine is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Arcanine is Knocked Out), the Attacking Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Burn Up
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard all Fire Energy cards attached to Arcanine.

abilities.name: Solar Eclipse
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Lunatone is in play, you may use this power. Until the end of your turn, Solrock's type is Fire. This power can't be used if Solrock is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Cosmic Draw
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, draw 3 cards.

abilities.name: Poison Resistance
abilities.text: Zangoose can't be Poisoned.

attacks.name: Target Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is Seviper, this attack does 10 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Super Slash
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is an Evolved Pokémon, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Energy Crush
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to all of your opponent's Pokémon.

abilities.name: Energy Variation
abilities.text: Kecleon's type is the same as every type of basic Energy card attached to Kecleon.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Pull Down
attacks.text: If your opponent has any Evolved Pokémon in play, remove the highest Stage Evolution card from each of them and put those cards back into his or her hand.

attacks.name: Hydrocannon
attacks.text: Does 30 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Omastar but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

abilities.name: Chaos Flash
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Golduck is your Active Pokémon, you may flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) is now Confused. This power can't be used if Golduck is affected by a Special Condition.

attacks.name: Special Blow
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any Special Energy cards attached to it, this attack does 30 damage plus 40 more damage.

attacks.name: Sand Swirl
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Earthquake
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness or Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Feint Attack
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rage
attacks.text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Steelix.

attacks.name: Spinning Tail
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Pikachu from your hand onto Pichu (this counts as evolving Pichu) and remove all damage counters from Pichu.

attacks.name: Energy Retrieval
attacks.text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to 1 of your Pokémon. Put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon for each Energy card attached in this way.

attacks.name: Confuse Ray
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Aqua Sonic
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Wobbuffet by your opponent's Pokémon-ex.

attacks.name: Flip Over
attacks.text: Wobbuffet does 10 damage to itself, and don't apply Weakness and Resistance to this damage.

attacks.name: Fast Evolution
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Evolution card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Scratch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Intimidating Fang
abilities.text: As long as Arbok is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Toxic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned. Put 2 damage counters instead of 1 on the Defending Pokémon between turns.

attacks.name: Drizzle
attacks.text: If you have Water Energy cards in your hand, attach as many Water Energy cards as you like to any of your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Max Bubbles
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Energy attached to all of your Active Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

abilities.name: Baby Evolution
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may put Marill from your hand onto Azurill (this counts as evolving Azurill), and remove all damage counters from Azurill.

attacks.name: Jump Catch
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Trainer card, show it to your opponent, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Rapid Spin
attacks.text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon, if any. You switch Baltoy with 1 of your Benched Pokémon, if any.

attacks.name: Ultra Energy Source
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the number of basic Energy cards attached to all of the Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Super Poison Breath
attacks.text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

attacks.name: Sky Uppercut
attacks.text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

attacks.name: Plasma
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to Electabuzz.

attacks.name: Thunder Spear
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 40 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

abilities.name: Baby Evolution

attacks.name: Gather Energy
attacks.text: Search your deck for a basic Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Double Wing Attack
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 20 more damage.

abilities.name: Exoskeleton
abilities.text: Any damage done to Kabuto by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Team Assembly
attacks.text: Search your deck for Omanyte, Kabuto, or any Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as Basic Pokémon.

abilities.name: Glowing Screen
abilities.text: As long as Volbeat is in play, any damage done to Illumise by attacks from Fighting Pokémon and Darkness Pokémon is reduced by 30. You can't reduce more than 30 damage even if there is more than 1 Volbeat in play.

attacks.name: Chaotic Noise
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Link Blast
attacks.text: If Kirlia and the Defending Pokémon have a different amount of Energy attached to them, this attack's base damage is 30 instead of 60.

attacks.name: Influence

attacks.name: Time Spiral

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 1 or Stage 2 card that evolves from that Pokémon in your hand, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.)

data.name: Claw Fossil
rules: Play Claw Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Claw Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Claw Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Claw Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Claw Fossil from play.

abilities.name: Jagged Stone
abilities.text: If Claw Fossil is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if Claw Fossil is Knocked Out), put 1 damage counter on the Attacking Pokémon.

data.name: Lanette's Net Search
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for up to 3 different types of Basic Pokémon cards (excluding Baby Pokémon), show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Root Fossil
rules: Play Root Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Root Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Root Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Root Fossil is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Root Fossil from play.

abilities.name: Spongy Stone
abilities.text: At any time between turns, remove 1 damage counter from Root Fossil.

data.name: Double Full Heal
rules: Remove all Special Conditions from each of your Active Pokémon.

data.name: Wally's Training
rules: You can play only one Supporter card each turn. When you play this card, put it next to your Active Pokémon. When your turn ends, discard this card.
Search your deck for a card that evolves from your Active Pokémon (choose 1 if there are 2) and put it on your Active Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

data.name: Mysterious Fossil
rules: Play Mysterious Fossil as if it were a Basic Pokémon. While in play, Mysterious Fossil counts as a Colorless Pokémon (instead of a Trainer card). Mysterious Fossil has no attacks of its own, can't retreat, and can't be affected by any Special Conditions. If Mysterious is Knocked Out, it doesn't count as a Knocked Out Pokémon. (Discard it anyway.) At any time during your turn before your attack, you may discard Mysterious Fossil from play.

data.name: Aggron ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Rend
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Metal Surge
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Gardevoir ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Feedback
attacks.text: Count the number of cards in your opponent's hand. Put that many damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psystorm
attacks.text: Does 10 damage times the total amount of Energy attached to all Pokémon in play.

data.name: Aerodactyl ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Primal Lock
abilities.text: As long as Aerodactyl ex is in play, your opponent can't play Pokémon Tool cards. Remove any Pokémon Tool cards attached to your opponent's Pokémon and put them into his or her discard pile.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Kabutops ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Hydrocutter
attacks.text: Flip a number of coins equal to the amount of Energy attached to Kabutops ex. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads. You can't flip more than 3 coins in this way.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Remove 2 damage counter from Kabutops ex (remove 1 if there is only 1).

data.name: Multi Energy
rules: Attach Multi Energy to 1 of your Pokémon. While in play, Multi Energy provides every type of Energy but provides only 1 Energy at a time. (Doesn't count as a basic Energy card when not in play.) Multi energy provides Colorless Energy when attached to a Pokémon that already has Special Energy cards attached to it.

data.name: Raichu ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dazzle Blast
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Mega Thunderbolt
attacks.text: Discard all Energy cards attached to Raichu ex.

data.name: Typhlosion ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Ring of Fire
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned, and can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Split Blast
attacks.text: Discard 1 Energy card attached to Typhlosion ex. If your opponent has more than 1 Defending Pokémon, you may do 50 damage to each of them instead.

data.name: Wailord ex
rules: When Pokémon-ex has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Super Deep Dive
attacks.text: If you don't have any Benched Pokémon, this attack does nothing. Remove 3 damage counters from Wailord ex. Switch Wailord ex with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: Does 100 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on Wailord ex.
